comment:
I LOVED THIS CLASS. Amy is the best professor, you're silly if you don't pick her. Come in this class with a open mind and creativity, because you're going to have to create you own news stories and conduct interviews. We had small quizzes here and there but the News stories are worth a lot. 


CHOOSE AMY COX
Sweet woman but is very boring. Sometimes I wanted to sleep during class and I did not want to go, but attendance is mandatory.

I really enjoyed professor Cox, easy lectures. Good amount of assignments - short quizzes on AP, four news stories, discussion posts, etc. She works well with her students and is always available to them. Definitely has high expectations for news stories, but offers good feedback and willing to talk through everything.

Amazing, that's all I need to say but I will say more. Cox made the course very interesting and SUCH a light load, so if you're someone who has jobs and other life stuff, take her! Quizzes are EASY. You do need a textbook & AP book for assignments, but the chapters are short. If she's teaching anything else I'm picking her immediately.

Professor Cox was a great professor. I only took the class online so I did not interact with her much but she was quick to respond when I reached out. The class was a good class. Interesting and not super hard. The hardest parts were the short quizzes on AP and grammar. Assignment instructions were clear though and class was not hard overall.

This class is not the easiest but she makes it so much better. If you get the books, you will do just fine. She is very easy to contact and she is always willing to help if you just reach out. I highly recommend taking her.

The class itself was difficult because there was a lot of work, but Professor Cox gave very good feedback. The only downside to her class is that she does not allow late work so if you're someone who struggles with deadlines she might not be a good professor for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took this class on campus in the spring, but had to drop it so i took it online over the summer. Best decision with professor Cox!!! This class is very easy, and her content is straight forward. She is a VERY easy grader. This class is easier online than in person!!! Take her, you wont regret it!!!

She was very helpful and very clearly passionate about the subject. Every week, we had some reading, usually an AP style or grammar quiz (they took 10 minutes), and a bigger assignment. You need the workbook and the AP style guide, but they were helpful and easy to read. She takes attendance but her attendance policy is more relaxed.

Professor Cox was great! The class was well organized and the assignments weren't overwhelming. For me, the AP style was the hardest part, the writing was easy. There is an SI group, too. She grades quickly and gives good feedback. Do the practice writing and submit it - she'll tell you where you're going wrong. Would take her again 100x.

Professor Cox is really great. She gives detailed feedback and truly wants her students to pass. She has a whole day of straight office hours where she can help you if needed. Her class is really easy to pass and she also gives great advice on internships!

SHE IS AMAZING. journalism major, or not. TAKE HER. you will actually learn with her. she shows interest in the students and gives amazing feedback. her work is not har per say, but she will guide you and keep you in the loop.

Really nice lady. Class is mandatory but we normally get out early. Quiz and exercise due every week but really easy. Splits up grammer and writing so its easier to learn. No tests. Writing. Gives feed back fast and helpful. Small lecture in class and then practice things together. Would for sure take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: I reall enjoy Professor Cox. She gives good feedback on major assignments, and it seems as if she really does care about her students. She incorporates how real life relates to the course. Not many grades, would definitely recommend her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Cox is a difficult grader, but gives great feedback. Do things exactly how she says and you will be fine. She speeds through grammar lectures and moves slowly through chapter lectures. She does not accept late work. Come to class because lectures build. Also, show up on time because quizzes are online and set for the first 10 minutes of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is from CNN. First time at KSU. Doesnt take late work. I took the 2 and half hour class we only stayed for 1-2 hours. Organized. She lectures but then you do examples in the book and interactive activities. Shes very sweet. The class itself is hard so she is a good professor. No tests besides the final, but you do take quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
